page.title: 06BROADS DESCRIPTION
page.content: The Broadlands are to me very peaceful with the reeds and rushes rustling in the wind and the occasional cry of geese and ducks.The water is sparkling in the sunlight and the coots paddling across the water with the graceful swans swimming alongside the odd fisherman fishing for a catch. The wide expanse of water holds many things,with the trees moving around its banks. The webbed feet of the coot go up the bank making prints into the soft mud. The seagulls swoop on the fish that are near the surface feeding on the insect life that falls in the river.The swans glide up the river with their heads high in the air like upperclass people.Sometimes boats come up and down the river with holiday makers coming for a peaceful weekend.
